bibl.title: Cablegram from L. Thompson to Laura Armistead Carter, September 17, 1925

div1.p: Thompson expresses sympathy for the death of Henry Carter.

div1.head: Cablegram from L. Thompson to Laura Armistead Carter, September 17, 1925
div1.opener:
Form 1
CABLEGRAM
ALL AMERICA CABLES
MEXICAN TELEGRAPH CO.
1126 CONNECTICUT AVE., N. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
TELEPHONE FRANKLIN 1169
JAMES A. SCRYMSER, FOUNDER
ALL AMERICA
CABLES
DIRECT CABLE SERVICE
BETWEEN
NORTH AMERICA
SOUTH AMERICA
CENTRAL AMERICA
CUBA, PORTO RICO
DOMINICAN REPUBLIC
AND OTHER
WEST INDIES
----
JOHN L. MERRILL, PRESIDENT
Cablegram received at 1120 CONNECTICUT AVE., N. W.,
WASHINGTON, D. C., to which office REPLY to this mes-
sage should be sent marked “VIA ALL AMERICA.”
DN WN DE 14/B
Date SEPT 17, 1925 SANTIAGO CHILE 13
LCD THOMPSON WASHINGTON DC
div1.p: PRESS REPORTS DEATH DOCTOR CARTER EXPRESS OUR SYMPATHY LAURA
div1.closer:
LONG __________________________________________________
The foregoing Cablegram was received “VIA ALL AMERICA.” Repetitions of doubtful words should be obtained through the company's
office, 1126 CONNECTICUT AVENUE, N. W., WASHINGTON, D. C., and not by direct application to the sender. No inquiry respecting this
message can be attended to without the production of this form.
